intro: Tabernaemontana sananho, commonly known as the African star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are borne in clusters and are particularly showy during the rainy season.
